message.content: cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. The paper deals with multi-hop question answering using neural networks, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Specifically, the paper proposes a method to extract a discrete reasoning chain over the text to answer a question, which involves named entity recognition and coreference resolution. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-categories of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Machine Learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper involves information retrieval (IR) techniques to gather information from different parts of a text, which could also place it in the cs.IR sub-category. Finally, the use of heuristics to derive pseudogold reasoning chains suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
